SENT.plain: Some dementias in the elderly are due to vascular diseases in particular arteriosclerosis of cerebral arteries

The question whether US examination of the extracranial cerebral supply vessels is a reliable means of recognizing this form of dementia has been investigated in patients with the clinical diagnosis of vascular dementia
Using direct/indirect Doppler and real-time techniques, we were able to detect pathological lesions in the extracranial supply vessels in only one-third of these patients
Thus, US examination of the vessels in the neck would appear to be of only limited differential diagnostic value
